intro: Driessenia inaequalifolia, commonly known as the unequal-leaved driessenia, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its palmate leaves, which are divided into five to seven lobes, giving it a distinctive appearance. It produces showy, yellow flowers that bloom in clusters, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Due to its unique morphology and ecological significance, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
